comment.shortText: Convenience functions for child process access, wrapped in Promises.
comment.text:
### Usage:
```
import { node } from 'hsnode';
node.child_process.exec('ls')
    .then((stdout, stderr) => {...})
    .catch(err => {...});
```

comment.shortText:
executes `command` in a child process and promises to return the stdout and stderr streams. 
let utils = require('./cpUtils');
utils.exec(cmd)
.then((stdout, stderr) => {...})
.catch(err => {...});
comment.returns: promise to provide the stdout and stderr streams from the child process.

Convenience functions for node file system functions, wrapped in Promises.
appends to a file either as binary or text and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the realPath of the file written to.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a directory and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a file and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` is a directory and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText:
returns a promise for the stats of the file addressed by `thePath`.
If `thePath` addresses a symbolic link, the stats of the link are returned.

creates any missing directories in `thePath` and promises to return the path name.
Characters after the last `/` in `thePath` will be interpreted as a filename, hence no directory willbe created form them.
Terminate `thePath` with a final `/` to indicate that all parts should be created.
FInally, for precaution `mkdirs` only creates directories within the current working directory.
comment.returns: promise to provide the path name

comment.shortText: determines if `thePath` exists and promises to provide `true` or `false`.
comment.returns: promise to provide `true` or `false`

comment.shortText: lists all files in a directory and promises to provide the list.
comment.returns: promise to provide a list of directory entries.

comment.shortText: reads a file either as binary or text and promises to provide the content.
comment.returns: promise to provide file content.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: reads a text file and promises to provide the content.
comment.returns: promise to provide file content.

comment.shortText: reads a text file and promises to provide the content.
comment.returns: promise to provide file content.

comment.shortText: determines the canonical path for `thePath`, resolving all symbolic links and '../'in the path.
comment.returns: promise to provide the real canonical system path.

comment.shortText: promises to delete a file or folder and return the file or folder name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the name of the removed file.

comment.shortText:
returns a promise for the stats of the file addressed by `thePath`.
If `thePath` addresses a symbolic link, the stats of the linked file are returned.
writes a file either as binary or text and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.text: `true`|`false` if file should be read as `utf8`|binary

comment.shortText: writes a text file and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.shortText: writes content to a file as a stream and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.shortText: writes a text file and promises to return the file name.
comment.returns: promise to provide the file name if successful.

comment.shortText:
# Utility functions for HTTP and HTTPS calls
Convenience functions for http and https access, wrapped in Promises.
-   {@link httpUtil.request request}: sends a http or https GET or POST request
-   {@link httpUtil.CachedHTTPGet CachedHTTPGet}: used for cached requests

Establishes a caching of retrieved sites. The class uses a cache location provided
during construction. Each `get` call will return a cache for the site, if available.
Otherwise, a call to the site is initiated and the result is cached at the specified location.
Any returned error codes, such as 404 messages, are treated as valid responses and cached
to be returned future in future calls.
Construct a cached get at a specified location int he file system.
Construct a cached get at a specified location int he file system.
the location for the cache
an optional {@link Digest `Digest`} authentication information
the location for the cache
an optional {@link Digest `Digest`} authentication information

comment.text: the URL to request, supports GET and POST

optional boolean: if `false`, a call to `request` will ignore
any cached version of the response

comment.shortText: Implements a Digest authentication, used in {@link request `request`} call.
Parse challenge digest
Update and zero pad nc
general HTTP response structure
Describes an incoming message; used in `Digest.testDigestAuth`
Compose authorization header
return `true` if double quotes are needed for `entry`
sends a http or https GET or POST request and promises to return the result.
comment.returns: promise to provide the result of the request.

comment.text: the URL to pass along to the GET or POST request
optional data to post. If provided, a POST request will be sent instead of the default GET

Logging convenience functions.
## Usage
This module extends the [hsUtil.log](https://helpfulscripts.github.io/hsUtil/#!/api/hsUtil/hsUtil.log) logging module
by adding a log file hook.
comment.text:
### Using a log file
```
import { log as gLog } from 'hsnode';
const log = gLog('mymodule');  // optional, to use a module specific log; otherwise uses the global instance
log.format('%MM%DD');
log.info('by the way:'); // -> 0817 info by the way:
log.logFile('l%YY%MM');  // -> 0817 info now logging to file l1608.txt
log.logFile(null);       // -> 0817 disabling logfile
log.error('oh dear!');   // -> 0817 error *** oh dear!
```

comment.shortText: # hsNode
